com.here.android.mpa.nlp

Interface SpeechToTextProvider


  • public interface SpeechToTextProvider
    Speech to text interface for start or stop listening for voice commands, cancel, pause, resume or destroy the Speech recognition service. If this interface is not implemented, the speech recognition service is entirely the responsibility of the application. Calling Speech recognition service APIs like Nlp.startListening() or Nlp.stopListening() would not do anything and Nlp would not be able to make sure no other voice is playing (e.g. navigation instructions) while the ASR is listening. To achieve better user experience, it's highly recommended that the application implements this interface and uses Nlp APIs: Nlp.startListening(), Nlp.stopListening(), Nlp.resume(Context), Nlp.pause().

    IMPORTANT: Natural language processor is a Beta feature. The related classes are subject to change without notice.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void cancel()
      Cancel the speech recognition.
      void destroy()
      Destroy the speech recognizer object.
      boolean isListening()
      Return whether the ASR is currently listening to speech.
      void pause()
      Pause ASR functionality (when Activity onPause event is called and Nlp.pause() is used.
      void resume(android.content.Context context)
      Resume ASR functionality (when Activity onResume event is called) and Nlp.resume(Context) is used.
      void start()
      Start listening for speech.
      boolean stop()
      Stop listening for speech.

    • Method Detail

      • cancel

        void cancel()
        Cancel the speech recognition.

      • destroy

        void destroy()
        Destroy the speech recognizer object.

      • isListening

        boolean isListening()
        Return whether the ASR is currently listening to speech. It is listening if ASR was started and results haven't been received yet.
        Returns:
        boolean: true of the ASR is currently listening to speech false otherwise.

      • pause

        void pause()
        Pause ASR functionality (when Activity onPause event is called and Nlp.pause() is used.

      • resume

        void resume(android.content.Context context)
        Resume ASR functionality (when Activity onResume event is called) and Nlp.resume(Context) is used.
        Parameters:
        context - The application context set via Nlp.init(Context, MapFragment, CollectionProvider, SpeechToTextProvider, Nlp.OnInitializationListener) or Nlp.init(Context, Map, MapGesture, CollectionProvider, SpeechToTextProvider, Nlp.OnInitializationListener)

      • start

        void start()
        Start listening for speech.

      • stop

        boolean stop()
        Stop listening for speech.
